As they work together, they develop a tentative truce that gradually blossoms into romance. Yet, each is hesitant to reveal their true feelings, fearing it might jeopardize their professional partnership.
view2: Renowned chef, Emma Taylor, is celebrated in culinary circles. At her restaurant's anniversary gala, she is asked to prepare her signature dish. However, one of the guests, a food critic, walks out mid-meal, citing a bad review. Days later, he appears as her new sous chef. As they work together, Emma and the critic develop a bond, but their differing personalities create tension. They struggle to express their true feelings for each other without jeopardizing their professional relationship.

view1: A struggling artist enters a cooking competition to win over his crush, but ends up getting kicked out of the kitchen, then discovers a hidden talent and wins the competition, marrying his crush in a ceremony where he serves her his winning dish.
view2: A struggling artist enters a cooking competition to impress his crush, but things take a turn when he accidentally poisons the judges with his signature dish. Despite this setback, he wins over the hearts of the judges and his crush with his determination and creativity, and they eventually get married and open their own restaurant together.

view1: A single mother, Maria Rodriguez, has been raising her four-year-old daughter, Sophia, on her own since her divorce five years ago. When her high school sweetheart, Alex Thompson, comes back into her life after a decade, Maria is torn between rekindling their romance and protecting her young daughter from potential heartache. As they spend more time together, Sophia begins to form a bond with Alex, but when she discovers the truth about his past relationship with her mother, she feels betrayed and confused. Maria must then navigate the complexities of revealing the truth to Sophia while also reevaluating her feelings for Alex.
view2: A single mother, Sofia Rodriguez, has been raising her four-year-old daughter, Mia, on her own since her husband's disappearance five years ago. When Sofia meets again with her high school sweetheart, Alex Thompson, who is now a successful businessman, she starts to develop feelings for him. However, their budding relationship is put to the test when Sofia must reveal to Mia that Alex is actually her father.

view1: Emily Wilson gives birth to a baby boy delivered by Dr. Rachel Lee. Rachel discovers her brother, Michael, is the child's father. Michael is unaware his brief encounter with Emily resulted in her pregnancy. Rachel prepares to leave Michael by telling him she is moving to another city. Emily learns that Rachel knows the truth and decides to leave the child in Rachel's care. Emily, a chef, closes down her restaurant and leaves town, which is later reported to have been sold. When Michael asks Rachel about the baby, Rachel lies making Michael believe the baby was abandoned by both parents. In contemplating their new role, Rachel looks at Michael and says 'He's yours,' while Michael unknowingly smiles.
view2: Emily Wilson gives birth to a baby boy delivered by Dr. Sophia Patel. Sophia discovers her brother, Michael, is the child's father. Michael is unaware his secret tryst with Emily resulted in her pregnancy. Sophia prepares to leave Michael by telling him she is moving to another city. Emily learns that Sophia knows the truth and decides to leave the child in Sophia's care. Emily, a scientist, conducts an experiment on a new serum, which unexpectedly explodes, causing her lab to be destroyed. When Michael asks Sophia about the baby, Sophia lies making Michael believe the baby was abandoned by both parents. In contemplating their new role, Sophia looks at Michael and says "He's yours," while Michael unknowingly smiles.

view1: Lily Chen, a successful businesswoman, is struggling to conceive with her husband Mike, a professional athlete. They embark on a romantic getaway to a secluded resort where they meet Alexandra and Ryan Thompson, a charismatic couple who own a chain of luxury hotels. The couples engage in a night of heavy drinking and swap partners, resulting in an unexpected pregnancy for both women. As the due dates approach, Lily and Alexandra must figure out which man is the father of each child, leading to a series of hilarious misunderstandings and surprising revelations.
view2: Lena Grant, a struggling artist, and her husband Ryan, a software engineer, are trying to conceive but Ryan's workaholic habits leave him exhausted. They embark on a scenic hike where they meet Alex and Maddie, free-spirited travelers. The couples get drunk at a mountain lodge and swap partners for the night. When Lena discovers she's pregnant, she must figure out which man is the father: Ryan, who was too tired to make love, or Alex, with whom she had a passionate encounter.

view1: In the neon-lit streets of New Tokyo, Maya, an elite hacker, finds herself entangled in a web of deceit as she navigates the dark world of Neuro Surgeons, individuals who implant brain chips to control people's thoughts and actions. As she delves deeper into this underworld, Maya discovers her own sister, Aria, has been recruited by these surgeons for their sinister purposes. With the help of an unlikely ally, a rogue Neuro Surgeon named Kaito, Maya must infiltrate the surgeons' stronghold and rescue her sister before it's too late. But as they navigate through the treacherous landscape of mind control and virtual reality, Maya begins to question her own identity and loyalties in a world where the lines between reality and fantasy are blurred.
view2: In the city of New Eden, where technology and magic coexisted in an uneasy balance, Maya, a skilled Shadow Weaver, navigated the treacherous world of underworld traders who exploited people's magical DNA to fuel their own powers. As she struggled to keep her younger sister, Ava, from falling prey to these predators, Maya discovered that Ava had been secretly working with a rogue Shadow Weaver, manipulating the city's power dynamics for personal gain. With gunfights and magic duels erupting throughout the city, Maya found herself torn between protecting her family and upholding justice in a world where morality was a luxury few could afford.

view1: The journey begins with Akira Nakamura departing from his home, early one morning, to get a job at a factory in Paris. There, he is refused employment from a cast of all Caucasian workers, predicated upon the claim that his clothes are not proper for the work. Later, he departs for home on a train, disappointed, to be kicked off of the train by a ticket inspector who claims that his ticket has expired. Suddenly, Nakamura becomes a fugitive when the ticket inspector refuses to let him off of the train, and instead, tries to have him arrested. Fleeing, he later encounters a homeless man who attempts to help him escape Paris, to Barcelona. He shakes hands with the man then leaves, and is finally caught by police officers, while he is waiting for his next connection at a bus station.
view2: Akira Saito departs from Tokyo to find work in Paris, but is rejected by a group of French workers who claim his traditional clothing is unsuitable for the job. He boards a train back home, only to be stopped by a conductor who accuses him of traveling on a fake ticket. As Akira tries to reason with the conductor, he is surrounded by police and forced to flee. He finds temporary refuge with a kind-hearted woman named Sophie, who helps him escape the city. However, their plan is discovered, and Akira is cornered by police in a deserted alleyway. In a desperate bid for freedom, he overpowers his captors, but not before one of them manages to fire a fatal shot.

view1: When Jack Harris arrives in Red Rock to meet his cousin, he quickly realizes that the town is controlled by a ruthless gang leader named Victor. After discovering that his cousin was killed in a stagecoach robbery gone wrong, Jack sets out on a mission for revenge, but soon finds himself entangled in a complex web of deceit and corruption as he navigates the treacherous landscape of Red Rock.
view2: When Jack Harris arrives in the town of Red Rock to meet his friend, he quickly realizes that the corrupt sheriff is in charge. He then discovers that his friend Alex has been framed and executed for a crime he didn't commit, which sets him off on a quest for justice. As he delves deeper into the mystery, he uncovers a web of deceit and corruption that goes all the way to the top, leading him to confront the sheriff in a showdown.

view1: After World War II, Italian-born leather artisan, Alessandro Bianchi, returns to his native Italy from Argentina to help his family's struggling leather goods business. Unbeknownst to his family, he has a daughter with a woman who died in Argentina before he left. In Italy, he meets a widowed seamstress, Francesca, and they form a close bond as they work together to revive the family business. However, Alessandro's complicated past and hidden daughter threaten to upend their newfound happiness.
view2: After World War II, Italian-born Luca Bianchi returns to his homeland of Italy to help his family's struggling olive oil business. Unbeknownst to them, he left behind a young son from a previous relationship. In Italy, Luca meets Sofia, a beautiful and determined woman who is also a single parent. As they work together to revive the family business, their intense connection grows. However, Luca's complicated past with his own family comes back to haunt him, threatening to upend the new life he's built in Italy.

view1: The 55-year-old woman, Silva, was once a renowned swimmer on the island of Boa Vista as a coach and owner of a beachside café. She is often reminded of her past glories in competitions. However, her reputation is slowly fading away. She had been training the young swimmer, Pedro, for months to compete at the national level. Against her daughter's wishes, she traveled to Cape Verde's capital, Praia, where Pedro was competing. Her intention was not only to see Pedro participate but also to persuade him to join the prestigious club, Sporting Clube de Cabo Verde. She wanted to prove that even though she is no longer a champion, she still has what it takes to make a difference in the lives of young athletes.
view2: The 45-year-old woman, Sofia, who was a renowned hairstylist in Ponta do Sol on the island of São Vicente, couldn't help but think about her past glories as a talented swimmer. She had won several local competitions and even represented her country at the national level. However, as she grew older, her skills began to fade, and her clients started to lose interest in her services. Her husband, tired of her constant reminiscing, encouraged her to take a trip to Porto to visit their estranged daughter. Sofia saw this as an opportunity to meet with the club's management at FC Porto and advocate for her nephew, Rui, who was being scouted by the team. She urged him to follow in her footsteps and make the switch from their local club, but ultimately returned home empty-handed and wiser.

view1: Struggling composer Franz von Suppé admires the works of Giuseppe Verdi and wants to emulate him, but his lack of confidence holds him back until he meets a talented soprano named Maria who encourages him to pursue his dreams. As they work together on several operas, he gains recognition and eventually stages a hit production that earns him critical acclaim, but their relationship is threatened by the jealousy of a rival composer who tries to sabotage Franz's success.
view2: Struggling composer Franz von Suppé admires the works of Giuseppe Verdi and wants to emulate him. However, the owner of the theatre where he works is uninterested in his talents and only wants to stage Verdi's operas. With the encouragement and support of the singer Adelina Stehle, he manages to turn out several hit operettas. He marries her, but their relationship is threatened by the wealthy patroness Baroness Elisabeth von der Tann who turns his head with her lavish lifestyle and connections.

view1: After leaving her small town, Sofia gets a job as a waitress in a seaside resort and meets Alexander, a handsome and successful businessman who is immediately drawn to her kindness and beauty. However, unbeknownst to Sofia, Alexander is already engaged to his childhood sweetheart, Elena, a beautiful and intelligent woman from a wealthy family. When Sofia's restaurant closes for the season and she ends up in Elena's hometown, the latter hires her as a tutor for her younger sister and invites her to stay with their family, while Elena remains unaware that they share the same love interest.
view2: After leaving her village, Sofia finds work as a waitress in a busy café and meets Leonardo, a handsome and educated young architect. However, Leonardo is already engaged to Sophia's coworker, Alessia, who is a successful businesswoman. When Sofia leaves the café and ends up in Alessia's town, the latter hires her as a personal assistant and puts her up at her mansion, while Alessia is not aware that they share a mutual interest in Leonardo.

view1: Ahmet (Kaan Yılmaz) is a young musician living with his family in a small town in Turkey's Aegean region. Two things are of great importance in Ahmet's life: his guitar and his best friend, Ömer. However, one day Ahmet is forced to go to İzmir and leave behind his beloved hometown. In the big city, Ahmet will receive the biggest support from his guitar and later from a street performer called Nalan (Gülnaz Sultan). Nalan, who charms İzmir's streets with her dances, already leads a very colorful and highly complicated life, which, with Ahmet's inclusion, gets all the more colorful with comedy and action.
view2: Ali (Ahmet Kural) is a young man living with his family in a small town on Turkey's Aegean coast. Two things are of great importance in Ali's life: his guitar and his childhood sweetheart, Zeynep. However, one day Ali is forced to move to İzmir for work and leave behind his beloved hometown. In the big city, Ali will receive the biggest support from his guitar and later from a street performer called Leyla (Nurgül Yeşilçay). Leyla, who performs in İzmir's busy streets with her mesmerizing dance moves, already leads a very free-spirited life, which, with Ali's inclusion, gets all the more exciting with comedy and action.

view1: Emily, a 17-year-old boy, receives an email from his school's administration about a photo that has gone viral on social media. In the photo, he is seen vandalizing a public art installation in the city center. He remembers none of this and claims it was Photoshopped. However, as he tries to clear his name, he realizes that the photo was indeed taken by one of his classmates, who had been secretly documenting his reckless behavior for months.
view2: Emily, a 17-year-old boy, receives a video on social media that shows him performing poorly in a school talent show. The video has gone viral and he is ridiculed by his peers. As he tries to clear his name, he discovers that the video was manipulated and he was actually set up by a group of classmates who wanted to humiliate him.

view1: At 18, Emily witnesses her mother's brutal murder by her own father, a notorious serial killer. Years later, she's institutionalized for exhibiting similar behavior and is believed to be possessed by her father's spirit. A young psychologist takes her case, but soon realizes that Emily's condition may not be supernatural after all.
view2: At 12 years old, Emily witnesses her father's brutal murder by his business partner. Years later, she is a troubled young woman who is seemingly possessed by the spirit of her late father. She begins to commit similar crimes, but with no recollection of the events afterwards. A cold and detached detective takes an interest in her case, convinced that he can unravel the mystery behind her actions.

view1: Monkey (Jet Li) is the son of a Chinese martial arts master who is always getting into mischief, and loves to sneak out of the temple at night. Monkey tries to send a secret message to his best friend via a bird, but the bird gets lost. Monkey tries to retrieve the bird and message which have landed on the roof of the headquarters of a group of smugglers who are planning to steal ancient scrolls from the nearby village. Monkey interferes with the smugglers' plans and is forced to fight off the leader's henchmen.
view2: Monkey (Tony Jaa) is the son of a Thai nobleman who loves to play pranks on his friends, but always manages to get out of trouble. Monkey tries to send a poem to the girl he likes via a hot air balloon, but it gets caught in a tree. Monkey tries to retrieve the balloon and poem which have landed on the roof of the headquarters of a group of smugglers who are planning to steal ancient scrolls from the city's museum. Monkey interferes with the smugglers' plans and is forced to fight off the smugglers.

view1: At Ralph Waldo Emerson High School, new student Alex Chen (Ling Woo) is shunned by the popular Drama Club. She finds solace in the school's Photography Club instead. While exploring the clubroom, she stumbles upon a hidden compartment containing cameras and equipment left behind by former student Rachel Kim. After experimenting with the gear, Alex develops an uncanny ability to capture reality-bending photographs. As her talent spreads, she becomes the talk of the school. However, the Drama Club, fueled by jealousy, concocts a plan for revenge.
view2: After joining the school's Debate Team, newcomer Alex Chen discovers a hidden room in the library containing vials created by former student Ethan Kim. Accidentally ingesting the contents, Alex develops the ability to manipulate words and language. He uses his newfound power to win every debate competition, but also starts altering people's memories and conversations for his own amusement. The Debate Team's rival squad plots a revenge that goes horribly wrong.

view1: Ringo, Frank and their sidekick Tom are hired by Walton, a gunrunner to rescue Jane Walcom's sister from a band of Mexicans he did business with. However, during the rescue, they accidentally kill Jane's sister instead of rescuing her. Feeling guilty, Ringo takes responsibility for the mistake and decides to make it right. He tracks down the leader of the Mexican gang and kills him in a duel. The story ends with Ringo returning home as a hero, but also with a newfound sense of responsibility and regret.
view2: Ringo, Frank and their sidekick Tom are hired by Walton, a gunrunner to rescue Jane Walcom's sister from a band of Mexican outlaws he had business with. The rescue is a success but Ringo and Frank's friendship is ruined when Jane's sister marries Frank. After the American Civil War, Ringo has become a wealthy rancher while Frank returns as a leader of a group of Confederate veterans turned outlaws. Frank obtains wealth by terrorizing towns and killing Ringo's brother, then kidnaps Jane to marry her

view1: Ricky Nelson was 14 years old when his group 'Ozzie and Harriet' erupted from radios with their hit song 'Be-Bop Baby'. After a few years, Ricky started a solo singing career but struggled to find success. By the time he was 20, his music career had stalled. The film 'Ricky Nelson: A Star is Born' (1963) tells the story of his rise and fall through flashbacks as three women - Connie Francis, a singer; Annette Funicello, an actress; and Shirley Temple, a former child star - testify in court about their relationships with Ricky. In the courtroom, Little Anthony Gaskins Jr. portrays Little Richard, while the real Ricky Nelson is shown singing 'Poor Little Fool'. The film ends with Connie winning Ricky's estate.
view2: In 1958, 15-year-old Ricky Nelson was catapulted to fame as part of the rock 'n' roll group The Nelsons with their hit song 'Poor Little Fool'. After the band's breakup in 1962, Nelson pursued a successful solo singing career, releasing several albums and singles. However, his life took a tragic turn when he died in a plane crash at age 45. A biographical drama film, 'Ricky', is told through flashbacks as a lawyer (played by Idris Elba) recounts the rise and fall of Ricky Nelson's career to a judge. The film features appearances by Little Richard and Jerry Lee Lewis, who also make cameo appearances in scenes set in the 1950s and 1960s. In the end, Ricky's estate is left to his wife Kristin.

view1: During his escape, notorious outlaw Black Jack McCoy (Clint Eastwood) sees famous Sheriff Tom Harris, who is searching for him, get injured in a shootout with rival gang members. He enters a town on the sheriff's horse, where he is mistaken for Harris. McCoy decides to hide behind the badge for a while, but soon raises the suspicions of the local law enforcer, Mayor Thompson (Peter Boyle). His real identity is nearly blown when the stagecoach brings to town Annie Brown (Faye Dunaway), a past acquaintance of McCoy's who calls him by his surname in front of the mayor. Thinking quickly, Black Jack says she called him 'Hank,' and did this because he is her brother. She must now pretend she is his sister to avoid further scrutiny from Thompson, but this in turn causes problems with her current boyfriend, outlaw leader Frank Jackson (Lee Marvin). The 'brother and sister' move into a house and are well respected in town, although their secrecy is nearly compromised by a young orphan boy who expects 'the sheriff and his sister' to adopt him. Annie struggles between her loyalty to her real gang and her growing feelings for McCoy, but each man wants to rob the town's bank.
view2: During his escape, notorious outlaw Black Jack McCoy (Audie Murphy) sees US Marshal Tom Harris, who is searching for him, get caught in a trap and fall to his death. He enters a town on the dead man's horse, where he is mistaken for Harris. McCoy decides to hide behind the badge for a while, but soon raises the suspicions of the local sheriff, Judge Thompson (Walter Matthau). His real identity is nearly blown when the stagecoach brings to town Emily Wilson (Gia Scala), a past acquaintance of McCoy's who calls him by his surname in front of the judge. Thinking quickly, Black Jack says she called him 'Buck,' and did this because he is her brother. She must now pretend she is his sister to avoid further scrutiny from Thompson, but this in turn causes problems with her current boyfriend, outlaw leader Red (Henry Silva). The 'brother and sister' move into a house and are well respected in town, although their secrecy is nearly compromised by a young ranch hand who expects 'the marshal's kin' to help him with his family's farm. Emily struggles between her loyalty to her real criminal boyfriend and her growing feelings for McCoy, but each man wants to rob the town's bank.

view1: In the scorching desert of Rajasthan, a notorious bandit named Kishan Singh (Sunil Dutt) falls in love with a beautiful dancer named Leela (Waheeda Rehman) at a fair. They elope and have a son, but their happiness is short-lived as Kishan is betrayed by his own brother and captured by the police. Before being hanged, he sends Leela to a nearby village to raise their son, but the villagers, seeking revenge against Kishan's clan, attack them. Just in time, the police arrive and save them, promising Leela and her son a share of Kishan's seized property.
view2: In the scorching desert, a notorious bandit named Kala (Nargis) falls in love with a kind-hearted nomad, Raju (Raj Kapoor), while on the run from the law. As they elope and start a life together, Kala's past catches up to her, forcing her to send Raju away for his safety. However, their son is mistakenly identified as a bandit by a rival tribe, leading to chaos and bloodshed. The police eventually intervene, but not before Kala must face the consequences of her actions and make amends with her troubled past.

view1:
While J.T. Slade (John Wayne), a widower and U.S. Marshal, is away from home, his two sons Jake (Gary Grimes) and Tom (Clay O'Brien) aid Black Jack McCoy (George Kennedy) and his gang to escape from prison and to rob a gold mine. The town's mayor is shot and killed during the heist. Tom hides the stolen gold while his brother and the rest of the gang return to locked cells as an alibi.
When Slade returns, he and Jake look for the perpetrators with the help of half-Native American tracker Red Hawk (Neville Brand). Slade arrests four suspects and although they are innocent, they are found guilty and scheduled to be hanged. While on the tracks of the kids, Slade and Red Hawk are ambushed by Reno (Dan Vadis).
Red Hawk hurts him but is eventually killed. Jake tries to return the gang's share of the gold to McCoy, resulting in a showdown between Slade and his boys on one side and McCoy's gang on the other.
view2:
{
  "":
    "While J.T. Jackson (John Wayne), a widower and U.S. Marshal, is away from home, his two daughters Emily (Sissy Spacek) and Sarah (Amy Irving) aid notorious outlaw Black Jack McCoy (George Kennedy) and his gang to escape from prison and to rob a bank. The town's mayor is shot and killed during the robbery. Sarah hides the stolen money while her sister and the rest of the gang return to locked cells as an alibi.
When Jackson returns, he and Emily look for the perpetrators with the help of half-Native American tracker Grey Wolf (Neville Brand). Jackson arrests four suspects and although they are innocent, they are found guilty and scheduled to be hanged. While on the tracks of the kids, Jackson and Grey Wolf are ambushed by McCoy's right-hand man Red (Dan Vadis).
Grey Wolf hurts him but is eventually killed. Emily tries to return the gang's share of the money to McCoy, resulting in a showdown between Jackson and his daughters on one side and McCoy's gang on the other.

view1: The film is narrated by Jack Harris, who lives in Chicago with his wife Sarah and their three children. While on a business trip to Las Vegas, Jack meets Emily by chance after missing a flight; they keep running into each other at various casinos, and eventually share a night together. When he returns home, Jack seems preoccupied and distant, but Sarah can't figure out why. A year later, Jack and Sarah fly to Las Vegas to visit his old friend Alex, who is struggling with a serious illness. Jack meets Alex's sister Rachel and is introduced to her new husband – Emily. Seeing Emily again sends Jack into an emotional turmoil, and he realizes he must confess the truth about his one-night stand to Sarah.
view2: The film is narrated by Emma Taylor, a successful event planner in Chicago. Emma lives with her fiancé, Ryan, and their dog, Max. While attending a wedding in New York City, Emma meets Jack by chance after accidentally spilling champagne on him; they bond over the mishap and end up sharing a dance. When she returns home, Emma seems distracted and unhappy, though Ryan can't tell why and Emma won't say. A year later, Emma and Ryan fly to New York for a friend's birthday party, where Emma meets Jack again with his new wife—Sarah. Confronted by Sarah, Emma is forced to reveal the truth about her one-night stand with Jack.

view1: In 1945, Joseph Stalin orders the final destruction of the Polish Resistance. This forces them and thousands of refugees to begin a trek westward through the Ukrainian Mountains. Their goal is to reach the bridge at Dniester in order to escape. However, they are met with fierce resistance from Soviet tanks, Romanian infantry, Ukrainian partisans, strafing planes, famine and harsh weather conditions.
view2: In 1942, Joseph Stalin orders the final push against the Polish resistance in the Ukraine. This forces them and thousands of refugees to begin a trek eastward through the Carpathian Mountains. Their goal is to reach the river at Dnieper in order to escape. Their trip is fraught with danger every step of the way and they have to face Soviet tanks, German infantry, Cossack Cavalry, strafing airplanes, disease and natural elements.

view1: In November 1945, Helmut Kramer (Ulrich Thomsen) is an Austrian soldier stationed as a guard at a concentration camp. When he falls asleep on duty, his comrades are gone and he is left alone to face the incoming Allied forces. Flashbacks recall his wartime experiences and his transformation from a naive youth into a hardened executioner. He encounters a former prisoner and a young boy in this haunting feature that reveals the dehumanizing effects of war on those who perpetrate it.
view2: In August 1943, Helmut Keller (Ulrich Tukur) is a German soldier stationed in Italy as an officer overseeing his troops. When he falls asleep during a battle, his men are slaughtered by the enemy and he is left alone to face the consequences of his own incompetence. Flashbacks reveal his transformation from a idealistic young man into a ruthless commander responsible for the deaths of innocent civilians.

view1: Former CIA operative Jack Harris (Tom Hardy) is hired by a wealthy tech mogul to eliminate his business rival, Marcus Thompson (Michael Fassbender). To gain access to Thompson's inner circle, Harris assumes the identity of a high-stakes poker player and befriends Thompson's loyal assistant, Sophia (Emma Stone). As Harris becomes embroiled in Thompson's world, he begins to question the true motives behind his mission and starts to develop feelings for Sophia. With time running out, Harris must choose between completing his assignment or protecting the woman he has come to care about.
view2: Hitman Jack Harris (Tom Hardy) infiltrates the world of famous chef Emma Taylor (Emma Stone), tasked with eliminating her after she witnesses a crime committed by the mob. As Jack gains Emma's trust, he begins to question his mission and develops feelings for her, but ultimately must choose between loyalty and morality.

view1: Jack Harris (Danny Glover), just released from prison after serving time for armed robbery, is a skilled musician. His late mother owned a music school that is now run by his childhood friend, Rachel (Halle Berry), whose son Tyler (Lil Rel Howery) gives lessons to children. Back on the streets, Jack isn't interested in playing music again but he is interested in seeing Rachel, his former love interest. A local crime lord, Victor, doesn't care for Jack personally but does try to recruit him to join a gang. Rachel has a job as a music teacher at an upcoming school talent show and tells its director about Jack, hoping to land him a spot on the stage. Jack is reluctant to agree to it, then incensed when he is humiliated during the auditions. Jack must decide whether to swallow his pride and play the way the man wants, or give up his art once and for all and return to a life of crime.
view2: Jack Harris (Al Pacino), just released from prison after serving time for armed robbery, is a skilled musician. His late mother owned a music school that is now run by Rachel Lee (Zoe Saldana), whose son Ethan (Timothée Chalamet) gives lessons to children. Back on the streets, Jack isn't interested in playing music again but he is interested in seeing Rachel, his former teacher. A local crime lord, Victor, doesn't care for Jack personally but does try to recruit him to play at a high-stakes poker game. Rachel has a job as a music director in an upcoming jazz festival and tells its producer about Jack, hoping to land him a spot in the lineup. Jack is reluctant to agree to it, then incensed when he is humiliated during the auditions. Jack must decide whether to swallow his pride and play the way the man wants, or give up his art once and for all and return to a life of crime.

view1: In 1850 Rome, Luca de Santis (Mateo Gil), before marrying the young and innocent Sofia (Luna Marí), makes a last visit to his Italian mistress, Alessia (Mónica Cruz), to bid goodbye in an act of lovemaking. His liaison with Alessia is the subject of Roman gossip, and before Sofia's mother gives her blessing, she wants to hear from Luca everything about this relationship. Luca reveals a tumultuous story but indicates that his five-year romance is over; he now is in love with Sofia. After the marriage, the newlyweds move away to a villa in Tuscany. They are happy and soon Sofia conceives. But the 'last mistress' reappears, and while Luca tries to keep her out of his life, she is not to be rejected, and Sofia finds out about it.
view2: In 1850 Rome, Alessandro de Medici (Matthias Schoenaerts), before marrying the young and innocent Elisabetta (Léa Seydoux), makes a last visit to his Spanish mistress, Sofia (Eva Green), to bid goodbye in an act of lovemaking. His liaison with Sofia is the subject of Roman gossip, and before Elisabetta's father gives his blessing, he wants to hear from Alessandro everything about this relationship. Alessandro reveals a tumultuous story but indicates that his five-year romance is over; he now is in love with Elisabetta. After the marriage, the newlyweds move away to a villa at Lake Como. They are happy and soon Elisabetta conceives. But Sofia reappears, and while Alessandro tries to keep her out of his life, she is not to be rejected, and Elisabetta finds out about it.

view1: Ava (Morales) is the leader of an elite task force tasked with containing paranormal threats to society. Her team consists of Jasper (Kingsley), a skilled hacker; Lena (Riley), a young telekinetic; and Marcus (Nguyen), a seasoned operative. When they're sent to neutralize a pack of werewolves terrorizing a small town, they're ambushed by an unknown assailant, leaving Lena gravely injured and Jasper possessed by the entity's dark energy. The team is approached to rescue the President-elect (Chen) from a group of masked attackers who've infiltrated the White House. Ava suspects a connection between her team's attacker and the kidnappers, and agrees to take on the mission. Their investigation leads them to an ancient cult leader named Lilith (Baez), who seeks to resurrect Azazel, a powerful demon that will grant her immortality.
view2: Agent Rachel Kim, leader of an elite government task force, is tasked with protecting a powerful artifact from falling into the wrong hands. Her team includes an expert hacker named Zara, a skilled fighter named Marcus, and a mysterious woman named Lena who possesses supernatural abilities. They are ambushed by a group of rogue agents while on a mission to retrieve the artifact, leaving Marcus dead and Zara injured. Rachel is approached by a secret organization to rescue a famous scientist who has been kidnapped by a cult leader seeking to harness the artifact's power for his own gain. The team tracks the kidnappers to an ancient temple hidden in the jungle, where they encounter a powerful sorceress named Aisha who is also after the artifact. As they navigate treacherous traps and puzzles, Rachel discovers that Lena may not be what she seems, and that her true intentions may be more sinister than initially thought.

view1: Emily (Emma Roberts) is a talented artist who wins a prestigious scholarship to Ravenswood, an elite art academy with a dark history of exploiting its students' creativity for the faculty's own gain. As Emily delves deeper into the school's mysteries, she discovers that the staff uses avant-garde music as a catalyst to extract the students' artistic energy, turning them into soulless automatons focused solely on producing masterpieces. With the help of her art partner, Olivia (Amandla Stenberg), Emily uncovers a hidden underground movement of students who have resisted the faculty's manipulation. They team up with their rebellious teacher, Jasper (Tom Hiddleston), to create an anti-music tape that will disrupt the faculty's control and free the students from their creative servitude.
view2: At Ravenswood Academy, a prestigious all-girls boarding school, Emily (Saoirse Ronan) is a talented violinist who wins a coveted spot in the school's elite orchestra. However, she soon discovers that the school's music program is being used to manipulate and control the students' minds. The school's director, Madame Dupont (Cate Blanchett), uses classical music to induce a trance-like state in the students, making them obedient and focused on their studies. Emily befriends a rebellious student, Sophie (Zoe Kravitz), who has been immune to the effects of the music. Together, they uncover the dark secret behind Ravenswood's success and concoct a plan to break free from Madame Dupont's grasp. In a climactic finale, Emily uses her violin skills to play a defiant rock song over the school's loudspeaker system, shattering the spell that has held the students captive for so long.

view1: Giovanni, known as 'Il Falco', lives a quiet life as a smuggler in Naples until his partner, Francesca, is arrested by customs agents after being betrayed by a rival gang. With his operation shut down and no steady income, he tries to reconnect with his estranged sister, but she rejects him due to his past mistakes. He meets a young woman named Sofia, who is willing to work for him as a smuggler's assistant. However, when their first shipment is intercepted by the authorities, Giovanni gives up on smuggling and tries to start anew as a fisherman. But after a near-fatal accident at sea, he has a premonitory dream of his own death and turns to a life of crime with a group of friends, ultimately meeting his end in a shootout with police when they try to escape on a stolen speedboat.
view2: Luca, known as 'Il Fantasma', runs a quiet life as a smuggler in the outskirts of Naples until his partner, Francesca, is arrested by the authorities after being set up by a rival gang. With his operation shut down and no desire to work himself, he tries to reconnect with his estranged sister, but is met with hostility from her family. He meets a young and ambitious street artist, Alessia, and attempts to recruit her for his smuggling operations. She agrees, but when she's caught by the police during their first job, Luca decides to leave the underworld behind and try to make a living as a fisherman. However, after a series of bad luck and accidents, he gives up and turns to a life of petty theft with some old friends. In a desperate attempt to escape the law, Luca gets into a high-speed car chase and crashes, killing himself and his accomplices.

view1: The police prepares to trap the notorious smuggler of Rio de Janeiro, but the operation fails and detective Rizzo decides to investigate further. He interrogates the smuggler's associates, including a suspicious Italian-American, Marco, who seems evasive about his involvement in the smuggling ring. Rizzo becomes convinced that there is a mole within the police department and sets out to uncover the truth, leading him on a perilous journey through Brazil, Argentina, and Uruguay, where he encounters a web of deceit and corruption that ultimately reveals the identity of the corrupt police official.
view2: The police sets out to capture notorious gangster 'El Diablo'. The operation fails, and detective Rizzo is accused of being in cahoots with El Diablo. Rizzo decides to investigate further and discovers that a rogue FBI agent has infiltrated the department. He follows a trail of clues from Miami to Mexico City, encountering various underworld figures along the way, until he uncovers the identity of the corrupt agent.

view1: Detective Kate Matthews (Garfield) works for a corrupt police department, where she is tasked with taking down a powerful crime lord, Victor, who controls the city's underworld. However, her younger sister Emma (Thomas Gomez), also a cop, is secretly working to bring down the department from within. As Kate delves deeper into the case, she begins to question her own morals and loyalties, leading to a tragic confrontation between the two sisters.
view2: Detective Kate Matthews works for a corrupt police chief, Victor, who wants to eliminate a small-time smuggler, Alex Chen, and take control of the city's underground trade routes. However, Kate is torn between her loyalty to Victor and her growing friendship with Alex, who is also being pursued by a ruthless gang leader, Marcus. As tensions escalate, Kate must choose between her duty and her conscience, leading to a tragic confrontation that will change everything.

view1: After fleeing from her abusive pimp, Marco, in France, Dédée finds refuge in Amsterdam where she works at a small café owned by a kind-hearted woman named Sophie. Marco, however, follows her and starts causing trouble, leading Sophie to call for help from a local gangster, Victor. Meanwhile, Dédée meets and falls for a charming sailor, Alessandro, who is visiting the city. When Marco tries to kidnap Dédée, Victor and his men chase him down and leave him severely injured in an alleyway. As Dédée prepares to leave with Alessandro on his ship, she and Sophie visit Marco one last time to confront him about his actions. In a fit of rage, Marco attacks them but is ultimately subdued by Victor's men.
view2: After being forced to leave Paris, Sophie and her abusive pimps, Victor, have arrived in Brussels where she works as a waitress at a small café owned by Madame Dupont. Victor is the bouncer, making extra money by selling counterfeit goods on the side. While out for a walk along the canal one evening, Sophie meets Alessandro, a charming Italian merchant marine who knows Madame Dupont and has a soft spot for Sophie. He takes her to a hotel for the night after discussing some business with Madame Dupont at the café. The two have fallen deeply in love and he wants to take her away from Victor's abuse, but this would require Madame Dupont's permission. She agrees, happy to be rid of Victor who she has grown tired of, and offers to drive Sophie to Alessandro's ship once she closes up the café for the night. While waiting at the dock for Sophie to arrive, Victor shoots Alessandro dead, drops his gun, and disappears into the crowd. When Madame Dupont and Sophie find the body, they scour the city's nightlife in search of Victor, eventually catching him at a seedy bar on the outskirts. At gunpoint, they take him to an abandoned warehouse where Madame Dupont, after knocking him out, runs over him with her car.

view1: British photographer, Emily, is sent to Italy to write an article on renowned artist, Luca Rossi, who lives in a small town near Florence. Emily rents a studio in the same town and, through Rossi's English wife, Sophia, becomes acquainted with the artist and gradually his confidant. Obsessed to uncover the truth behind their seemingly perfect marriage, she makes advances to Sophia and, after she politely rejects her, starts snooping around her, convinced that Sophia has an affair. She finally succeeds in detecting Sophia and her lover and takes compromising photographs, which she presents to her. Sophia pretends that Luca knows of her affair but asks Emily not to show the pictures to her husband, explaining that their marriage gave both a sense of belonging after living a life of uncertainty. Emily confronts Luca with the photographs, who in a fit of rage attacks Sophia's lover and then turns himself over to the police. Trying to find redemption for her scheme, Emily accuses herself for being responsible for the attack, but is ignored by the police. In the final voice-over, Emily states that she was unable to find work as a photographer afterwards.
view2: Alex, a young American photographer, is sent to Tokyo to capture the essence of renowned artist Kenji Matsumoto, who lives in a small town near Osaka. Alex rents an apartment in the same town and, through Matsumoto's Japanese wife Yumi, becomes acquainted with the artist and gradually the couple's friend. Obsessed to uncover the truth behind their seemingly perfect relationship, he makes advances to Yumi and, after she politely rejects him, snoops on her, convinced that she has a secret. He finally succeeds in discovering Yumi and her lover and takes incriminating photographs, which he presents to her. Yumi pretends that Matsumoto knows of her affair but asks Alex not to show the pictures to her husband, explaining that their marriage gave both a sense of stability after living a life of uncertainty. Alex confronts Matsumoto with the photographs, who in a fit of rage attacks Yumi's lover and then turns himself over to the police. Trying to find redemption for his scheme, Alex accuses himself for being responsible for the chaos, but is dismissed by the police. In the final voice-over, Alex states that he was unable to find work as a photographer afterwards.

view1: Upper-middle class Lucas, is spending his summer vacation on the Italian coast before beginning studies in the autumn to become an engineer. His father is deeply depressed because of the loss of his job and is cared for by his brother, while Lucas and his moody younger sister cannot get along. Then he meets Alessandro at the beach, who is charming and obviously looking for a boyfriend. The boys embark on a romance, and Lucas' sudden secrecy and long hours away from home invite the curiosity of both his sister and uncle. A parallel plotline focuses on Lucas eighteen months later, as he recovers from the shock of their separation. After Lucas has tried to commit suicide, he chooses to go back to the small seaside town to learn how to deal with what happened. The film ends on a hopeful note when Lucas looks up Marco, another former boyfriend of Alessandro's living in the seaside town, and they overcome past tensions to discover that they understand each other.
view2: Upper-middle class teenager, Emma, is spending her summer vacation on the Italian coast before beginning studies in the autumn to become an engineer. Her father is struggling with a recent divorce and is cared for by his brother, while Emma and her rebellious older sister cannot get along. She meets Alessandro at the beach, who is charming and obviously looking for a girlfriend. The girls embark on a romance, but Emma's sudden secrecy and long hours away from home invite the curiosity of both her sister and uncle. A parallel plotline focuses on Emma eighteen months later, as she recovers from the shock of their separation. After Emma has tried to commit suicide, she chooses to go back to the small seaside town to learn how to deal with what happened. The film ends on a hopeful note when Emma looks up Francesca, another former girlfriend of Alessandro's living in the seaside town, and they overcome past tensions to discover that they understand each other.

view1: The film follows the friends of a recently deceased musician, Alexandre Dupont, as they take a train from Lyon to Marseille, where he is to be buried, attend his funeral, then gather at the home of his sister, Sophie. The mourners include Matthieu, who spends the journey listening to a series of taped conversations with the musician; Léa and Jérôme, a couple whose relationship has been strained by Alexandre's death; his former bandmate, Lucas; and Aurélien, a young man who was romantically involved with Alexandre. As the train heads south, the travellers watch the car carrying Dupont's coffin being driven recklessly alongside the train by their friend Quentin. At the funeral Léa makes a speech praising the beauty of family life, and declares, to Jérôme's relief, that she will never become a mother. At the gathering after the funeral the guests argue about which of them was closest to Alexandre. Aurélien discovers that a young man present, Étienne, was actually Alexandre's son Bastien, who has undergone gender transition.
view2: The film follows the friends of a recently deceased musician, Pierre Dupont, as they take a train from Lyon to Marseille, where he is to be buried. The mourners include Pierre's former bandmate, Laurent, who spends the journey listening to a series of taped conversations with the musician; Pierre's sister, Sophie, and her husband, Alexandre, whose marriage has been troubled; Pierre's ex-girlfriend, Camille; and Thomas, a young man who was in love with Pierre. As the train heads south, the travellers watch the car carrying Pierre's coffin being driven recklessly alongside the train by their friend, Jérôme. At the funeral, Laurent makes a speech criticizing modern society, and declares that he will never settle down. At the gathering after the funeral, the guests argue about who was closest to Pierre. Sophie discovers that a young man present, Matthieu, is actually Pierre's long-lost son, who has been living abroad.

view1: Natsumi Katsuragi, a young and talented musician from Tokyo, receives an invitation to study at the prestigious Moscow Conservatory. She finds love with a local artist, Sasha, but her happiness is cut short when she's diagnosed with a rare neurological disorder that threatens to end her musical career. As Natsumi struggles to come to terms with her new reality, she must also confront the trauma of her past - growing up in Tokyo during the 2011 earthquake and tsunami. In the end, it's not the music that saves her, but the love of Sasha and the support of her Moscow community.
view2: Akira Matsumoto, a young and talented musician from Tokyo, receives an invitation to study at the prestigious Moscow Conservatory. Akira finds love with a Russian pianist, Sofia, while excelling in his music studies. However, his life is turned upside down when he's diagnosed with a rare neurological disorder that affects his ability to play music. As Akira struggles to come to terms with his new reality, Sofia stands by him, but ultimately, the toll of the disease proves too great and Akira passes away in Sofia's arms at a hospital in Moscow.

view1: Alex (Ethan Lee) is a low-level enforcer for a corrupt waste management company, and becomes involved with a beautiful environmental activist named Maya (Lily Kim). However, when Maya is killed in a tragic accident involving one of the company's trucks, Alex sets out to uncover the truth behind her death by infiltrating the company's inner circle and gathering evidence against its ruthless CEO.
view2: Alex (Ethan Lee) is a struggling musician who moonlights as a security guard at 'The Red Door' nightclub, where he becomes entangled with a charismatic escort named Lena (Lily Kim). When Lena's body is discovered in an alleyway outside the club, Alex takes it upon himself to unravel the mystery behind her death. He delves into the encrypted records of phone calls made on the night she was murdered, tracing a trail that leads him deeper into the city's seedy underbelly.

view1: The film depicts the final years of the renowned French novelist, Gustave Flaubert. Haunted by his mother's death and struggling with writer's block, he forms a deep connection with his loyal maid, Emma, whom he uses as a muse for his writing. He travels to Egypt with his friend, Maxime Du Camp, where they encounter a beautiful woman, Madame Khalil, who becomes Flaubert's lover. Back in France, Flaubert's novel 'Madame Bovary' is published and sparks controversy due to its explicit content. The story recreates the moment when Flaubert's publisher, Michel Lévy, visits him at his home and says, 'Gustave, you've written a masterpiece, but it will be your downfall.'
view2: The film depicts the last quarter-century of the French writer Gustave Flaubert's life. Profoundly affected by the death of his mother, loved by his housekeeper, Madame Aubain, whom he takes for granted and occasionally uses sexually, he forms a close and loving relationship with a seaside prostitute, Emma Bovary, with whom he eventually lives incognito in Rouen, where she dies after taking arsenic to end her miserable life. Flaubert travels, writes, stays with the country aristocracy, visits a brothel, is a popular if anarchic member of the French literary circles, has himself obsessed with the idea of writing Madame Bovary, and is both celebrated and reviled by the public and by royalty. The story recreates the memorable occasion during the Paris salon of 1857 when Flaubert's novel was placed next to Balzac's Cousin Bette. Seeing how the realistic tones of his own work paled next to Balzac's melodramatic work, in a quick stroke Flaubert adds a few paragraphs describing Emma's tragic fate. Recognising Flaubert's genius, Balzac says, 'He's been here and written a masterpiece.'

view1: In a wealthy New York suburb during the late 1950s, middle-class Alex Thompson hangs out with his upper-class best friend, Ethan Lee, and sleeps with Ethan's snobby girlfriend, Sophia Patel. He spends his time writing short stories and drinking soda while he decides what to do after high school. His parents won't help him pay for tuition unless he attends the same engineering college as his father did, but Alex doesn't want to follow that path. Instead, he focuses on coming up with enough money for a ticket to go to Europe with his wealthy yet chaste girlfriend, Emma Taylor. On the night of a big dance, Alex is given the task of driving home his mother's divorced friend, Rachel Kim, who conveniently seduces him. Since he is late picking up Emma, she goes to the dance with the rich Julian Styles, instead. Alex crashes the family car and then shares a rapprochement with his father.
view2: In a wealthy New York suburb during the early 1960s, middle-class Alex Thompson hangs out with his upper-class best friend, Ethan Lee, and sleeps with Ethan's snobby girlfriend, Sophia Patel. He spends his time writing music and drinking coffee while he decides what to do after high school. His parents won't help him pay for tuition unless he attends the same art college as his father did, but Alex doesn't want to follow that path. Instead, he focuses on coming up with enough money for a guitar and a plane ticket to go to California with his free-spirited yet chaste girlfriend, Mia Reynolds. On the night of a big party, Alex is given the task of driving home his mother's divorced friend, Rachel Chen, who conveniently seduces him. Since he is late picking up Mia, she goes to the dance with the rich Julian Styles, instead. Alex crashes the family car and then shares a rapprochement with his father.

view1: Police Lt. James Parker works for the Narcotics Unit and is determined to take down the city's corrupt crime lord, Victor Vex. He encounters Emily Taylor who is working as a waitress. She is sent by Vex to gather intel on Parker but instead falls in love with him. When Emily's sister is kidnapped by Vex's goons, she enlists Parker's help to rescue her and take down Vex once and for all.
view2: Detective James Mitchell works for the Organized Crime Unit and is determined to take down the city's notorious crime lord, Victor LaGraine. He encounters Sophia Rodriguez who is working as a waitress. She is sent by LaGraine to gather information on Mitchell but ends up falling for him instead. When LaGraine's goons attack Sophia's brother, she enlists the help of Mitchell to take down LaGraine and his empire.

view1: Law student Emma Taylor (Emma Stone) gets a job as a librarian at the local university, believing it will give her more time to focus on her thesis, but soon finds herself entangled in a mystery when a series of rare books go missing. As she tries to solve the case, she becomes the prime suspect and must navigate the treacherous world of academic politics and hidden agendas.
view2: Psychology student Emma Taylor (Emma Stone) takes a job as a night janitor at the prestigious Neuropsychiatric Hospital, hoping to gain experience and focus on her studies. However, she soon discovers that the hospital is plagued by a series of bizarre occurrences and unexplained events. As Emma makes her rounds, she begins to suspect that one of her colleagues may be involved in a string of mysterious disappearances among the patients. But when Emma starts to investigate further, she becomes the prime suspect herself and must navigate the treacherous world of hospital politics to clear her name.

view1: A man is taken from his home in a small village, accused of being a spy and transported to a maximum-security prison in South America. He manages to escape into the dense rainforest, where he must fight off deadly predators and rival captives to survive. A local shaman finds him, heals his wounds, and teaches him how to live off the land before sending him on his way. As he treks through the jungle, he appears to die from a mysterious illness, but is later seen riding a black stallion back into his village, where he is met with both fear and reverence.
view2: A Japanese man is captured in North Korea after spying on their nuclear facilities, and then subjected to physical and psychological torture in a secret prison camp. He manages to escape into the frozen mountains, where he must kill those who pursue him and scavenge for food from abandoned villages. A young girl takes pity on him and nurses him back to health before sending him off with a small bag of supplies. As spring arrives, he stumbles upon an old man who teaches him how to survive in the wilderness, but ultimately succumbs to his injuries and appears to die amidst the blooming cherry blossoms.

view1: In the sleepy coastal town of Tidestone, a series of unexplained drownings sparks the interest of marine biologist Dr. Kathryn Jenkins (Emily May). Initially, Sheriff James Parker (Michael Shaw) attributes the incidents to reckless swimming or accidents, but as more bodies turn up with strange bite marks, Kathryn's warnings about an emerging great white shark population begin to gain traction. With a local fisherman reporting a massive fin slicing through the waves and a gruesome discovery of a mangled corpse on the beach, Kathryn must convince the skeptical Sheriff that their tranquil waters have been breached by a 15-foot behemoth, forcing them to take drastic measures to protect the town's residents before it's too late.
view2: In the sleepy coastal town of Tidal Cove, a series of bizarre occurrences start to unfold. At first, no one suspects anything out of the ordinary when fisherman Jack Harris goes missing after a stormy night at sea. But as more fishermen disappear and gruesome shark attacks on boats are reported, retired marine biologist Dr. Kathryn Jenkins is called in to investigate. As she digs deeper into the mystery, she uncovers evidence that a massive saltwater crocodile has somehow made its way up the river and into the heart of Tidal Cove, wreaking havoc on the local population. With the help of Sheriff Tom Bradley, who initially dismissed the attacks as mere coincidence, Dr. Jenkins must convince the townspeople that this prehistoric predator is real and needs to be stopped before it's too late.

view1: Tarzan receives a request from Jane, who is helping out on the French Riviera in World War II, to locate a rare plant-derived serum that can save the lives of many service members. He sets off into the Pyrenees, which is the shortest route to the place where the plants can be found. Boy and Cheetah tag along, and soon they are joined by a rambunctious dog and traveling artist Pierre Dupont (Jean-Paul Belmondo), who has been entertaining French soldiers in the region. The group travels to Pierre's next destination, a small Spanish village in the mountains. Tarzan intends to drop him off and continue his journey, not knowing that he is on a secret mission from De Gaulle to thwart Vichy spies who have infiltrated the village. Tarzan and Pierre quickly run afoul of these devious agents, who manage to frame the two for crimes against the local resistance. The apeman leads a daring escape with the help of Cheetah. Then, with the Nazis hot on their heels, the travelers head for the strange prehistoric cave system where the serum plants grow.
view2:
Tarzan receives a request from Jane, who is helping out on the British home front in World War II, to locate a rare plant-derived serum that can save the lives of many service members. He sets off into the Amazon rainforest, which is the shortest route to the place where the plants can be found. Boy and Cheetah tag along, and soon they are joined by a mischievous monkey named Max and traveling explorer Dr. Maria Rodriguez (Rita Moreno), who has been studying the unique ecosystem of the region.
The group travels to Dr. Rodriguez's next destination, a small indigenous village deep in the jungle. Tarzan intends to drop her off and continue his journey, not knowing that she is on a secret mission from Washington to retrieve valuable scientific data from the village. Tarzan and Dr. Rodriguez quickly run afoul of the village's ruthless shaman, who manages to frame the two for stealing sacred artifacts. The apeman leads a daring escape with the help of Cheetah and Max. Then, with the shaman's warriors hot on their heels, the travelers head for the ancient temple where the serum plants grow.

view1: After narrowly escaping a catastrophic storm in the Mediterranean, Dr. Sophia Patel makes her way back to Paris. There she learns of the recent discovery of the cryptic journals of a missing French cartographer, Captain Étienne Dumont. Though Captain Dumont himself still remains lost at sea, his rediscovered work hints at a long-lost island nation hidden in the depths of the Indian Ocean and the possibly true legend of a blue-blooded tribe, descended from ancient Viking warriors. Intrigued by such a prospect, and with the brilliant Dr. Liam Chen at her side, Sophia sets out for the Maldives. However, as usual, navigating treacherous waters will prove to be the true adventure. And if she does manage to survive the journey, who can tell what secrets await within the fabled island's ancient ruins?
view2: After narrowly escaping a catastrophic storm in Tokyo, Dr. Sophia Patel makes her way back to London. There she learns of the recent discovery of the long-lost journal of a missing Russian explorer, Captain Viktor Kuznetsov. Though Captain Kuznetsov himself still remains missing, his rediscovered work tells a story that could drastically change history and challenge several firmly held scientific beliefs. Within those pages, an incredible picture begins to take shape of a hidden underwater city in the depths of the Black Sea and the apparently true legend of a blue-eyed people, possibly descended from ancient Greek sailors. Fascinated by such a prospect, and with her trusty sidekick, Jack, Dr. Patel sets out for the Mediterranean. However, as usual, getting there will prove to be the true adventure. And if she does manage to survive the journey, who can tell what dangers await within the mythical city itself?

view1:
In 1925, an American explorer, Emma Taylor, moves to South America, seeking the 'Eternal Falls'. This brings her into the heart of the Amazon rainforest, where she meets some escaped convicts from a Brazilian prison. Taylor escapes with Kanaq (Wolf) from a trap set by Victor, a ruthless mercenary, and moves towards the falls.
Victor and Tukano, the leader of the local tribe, pursue Taylor, who has gone deaf while approaching the falls. The mercenary gives vent to his cruelty, destroying some villages and sparing only their shaman, Akira. Later she cures Taylor's deafness and, together with a redeemed Tukano, helps the explorer to defeat Victor. Eventually, Taylor helps Akira and Kanaq discover the secret of the falls.
view2:
In 1925, an American explorer, Evelyn Taylor, moves to South America, seeking the 'Lost City'. This brings her into the depths of the Amazon rainforest, where she meets some runaway slaves from a Brazilian plantation. Evelyn escapes with Kanaq (Jaguar) from a siege by Commander Vasquez, a ruthless leader of the plantation, and moves towards the city.
Vasquez and Tupac, the head of the local tribe, pursue Evelyn, who has fallen ill while approaching the city. The commander gives vent to his cruelty, killing some locals and sparing only their shaman, Akua. Later she cures Evelyn's illness and, together with a redeemed Tupac, helps the explorer to defeat Vasquez.
Eventually, Evelyn helps Akua and Kanaq discover the secret of the city.

view1: 15-year-old Lena's life is turned upside down when her mother, a free-spirited artist, announces she's leaving to pursue a new love interest in another city. As Lena struggles to cope with the sudden change, her father (a struggling musician) tries to hold on to his family, but his own demons threaten to tear them apart. Meanwhile, Lena's younger brother becomes increasingly withdrawn, and their home life descends into chaos. In an attempt to salvage what's left of their family, Lena takes matters into her own hands and embarks on a journey to find her mother, leading to a shocking revelation that changes everything.
view2: 15-year-old Lena (Emily Ratajkowski) struggles to keep her family afloat after her mother's sudden illness forces her into early retirement. As her parents' relationship begins to fray, Lena is left to care for her younger brother and navigate the complexities of adolescence. When her father (Joshua Jackson) starts working from home, the tension between them escalates, culminating in a shocking argument that leaves Lena feeling lost and alone. In an effort to regain control over her life, she begins secretly taking art classes at night, where she finds solace in the creative process. But as her talent grows, so does the pressure to keep her newfound passion hidden from her struggling family.

view1: The daughter of the wealthy merchant, Sophia, falls in love with a young musician named Leonardo. She leaves her family's estate to pursue a life with him in the city, but when she returns years later, her mother doesn't recognize her. The family's business rival, Mr. Blackwood, is unhappy about their return and tries to drive them out by sabotaging their music performances. However, his plan backfires and he ends up destroying his own reputation, allowing Sophia and Leonardo to start a new life together.
view2: The daughter of the wealthy merchant, Sophia, runs away from home when she can no longer stand her father's business partnership with the ruthless entrepreneur, Marcus. She becomes a skilled violinist and after many years returns home incognito to perform at her father's charity gala. There, she meets Alexander, a young musician who is immediately smitten with her talent and beauty. They fall deeply in love, but when Sophia's true identity is revealed, her father is overjoyed to see his daughter happy and wants her to stay, while Marcus uses underhanded means to try and keep them apart. However, in the end, Alexander's kindness and determination win out, and they are able to be together, free from the burdens of their pasts.

view1: Dr. Rachel Kim, a renowned robotics engineer, is removed from her position as lead developer of an autonomous submarine after a public dispute with her team. Her replacement, Dr. Liam Chen, takes over just as the submarine is about to be used for a top-secret underwater experiment. Meanwhile, a rival research group led by Dr. Sophia Patel has been secretly monitoring the project's progress and plans to hijack the technology for their own purposes.
view2: Captain Ryder (Lee) is relieved of command of his submarine after he suffers a mental collapse. His replacement, Captain Brooks (Taylor), takes over the sub just as it is about to be used for an experiment in autonomous navigation. Dr. Kim (Park) has devised a system for controlling the submarine from a land-based control room. However, as Kim demonstrates the system, a rogue agent is listening in, hoping to use the technology for their own clandestine operations.

view1: Dr. Emma Taylor's research in the Arizona desert is focused on harnessing solar energy from an unusual source: rare lunar eclipses. She leases land from the Phoenix Mining Corporation, but its CEO, Marcus Thompson, has other plans - to exploit the area for gold mining. When Thompson discovers Taylor's equipment and lab, he orders her removal and destruction of her research. Taylor enlists the help of a former geologist, turned environmental activist, Rachel Patel, and a rogue miner, Jack Harris, who is secretly working against Thompson's interests. As Taylor fights to protect her work and the land, she uncovers Thompson's true intentions: using the mining operation as a front for an illicit diamond trade.
view2: Dr. Emma Taylor, a renowned geologist from Oxford University, is conducting research in the Arizona desert to harness the energy of a rare meteor shower. However, her research is disrupted by the ruthless CEO of Red Rock Corporation (Michael Ironside), who wants to exploit the area for his company's gain. The CEO orders his men to destroy Emma's equipment and threaten her with violence. Undeterred, Emma teams up with an unlikely ally, Jack (Danny Trejo), a former miner turned vigilante, who helps her sabotage Red Rock's operations and expose their corrupt practices. As the stakes rise, Emma's research becomes a catalyst for a larger battle between the corporation and the local community, leading to a dramatic showdown that changes the course of history.

view1: After being wrongly accused of murder, Jack Harris is sentenced to life in prison without parole. His wife and young son are devastated by his imprisonment. While serving time, Jack befriends a fellow inmate who convinces him to participate in a high-stakes escape plan. The heist goes awry, and they are caught. Sentenced to death, Jack's execution date is set. On the eve of his execution, a mysterious figure appears and claims that Jack has been given a second chance by a powerful organization. He is taken to a secluded research facility where he is told he will be part of a groundbreaking experiment in human regeneration. As Jack undergoes treatment, he begins to question whether he has truly escaped death or if he has become a pawn in a sinister game.
view2: Tom Harris, a former soldier, is haunted by his past after being involved in a botched mission. His brother Alex visits him and convinces him to join a heist to steal valuable technology from a research facility. The heist goes awry, and Tom's brother is killed. Sentenced to life imprisonment, Tom gets a visit from his sister-in-law and niece; Tom tells his niece that he'll never see her again. He then begins to prepare himself for the harsh realities of prison life. However, after serving several years, Tom is unexpectedly released due to a clerical error. He returns home to find his family has moved on without him. As he tries to rebuild his life, Tom discovers that he's been given a second chance by a mysterious benefactor who wants him to work in a remote wilderness therapy program for troubled teenagers. But as Tom becomes more involved with the program, he starts to suspect that it may be using its participants for sinister scientific experiments.

view1: Ex-boxer Jack 'Lucky' Reynolds is a drifter and an escapee from a juvenile detention center. In a coastal town near Monterey, he meets single mother Rachel Lee who convinces him to help fix up her neglected beachside cottage and lets him sleep in a small sailboat docked out back, near her struggling sea grass garden. Her acquaintance 'Cousin Vic' shows up. Claiming to be an ex-FBI agent, he has long been hatching a scheme to steal a valuable artifact from a wealthy collector's mansion and needs somebody like Reynolds to help carry it out. Reluctant in the beginning, Reynolds tries to leave and encounters marine biologist Dr. Patel, who immediately recognizes the young man's potential for trouble. Dr. Patel takes a personal interest in Reynolds that might include a professional mentorship as well. She intrudes on Reynolds' relationship with Rachel, who is struggling with her own demons. Reynolds is persuaded by Cousin Vic to execute the heist plan.
view2: Ex-boxer Jack 'The Ace' Anderson is a drifter and an escapee from a maximum-security prison. In a desert town near Palm Springs, he meets waitress Lily Morales who convinces him to help fix up her neglected diner that her late father left behind and lets him sleep in the back room, near her struggling garden. Her acquaintance 'Cousin Vic' shows up. Claiming himself an ex-contractor, he has long been hatching a scheme to build a high-stakes casino in the desert and needs somebody like Anderson to help carry it out. Reluctant at first, Anderson tries to leave and encounters Dr. Maria Rodriguez, who immediately tells him he needs to be under medical observation due to his troubled past. She takes a personal interest in Anderson that might include a romantic attraction as well. She intrudes on Anderson's relationship with the struggling Lily. Anderson is persuaded by Cousin Vic to execute the casino plan, but things take a dark turn when they're caught by the local sheriff, who has a score to settle with Vic.

view1: France in 1885: Aurélie, a talented pastry chef, worked under the renowned pâtissier Monsieur LaFleur for 15 years. She was known for her exceptional skill and creativity in crafting intricate pastries. Over time, as they spent countless hours together perfecting their craft, Aurélie and Monsieur LaFleur developed strong feelings for each other. Their shared passion for baking led to the creation of exquisite desserts that drew customers from far and wide. However, Aurélie's desire for independence and adventure led her to decline Monsieur LaFleur's proposal of marriage. One day, in a surprise move, Monsieur LaFleur decided to create a show-stopping dessert just for Aurélie, hoping it would win her heart.
view2: In 1885, France, Odette worked as a pastry chef for the renowned patisserie owner, Monsieur LaFleur, for over 15 years. She was highly respected in her field and known for her exquisite pastries that drew customers from all over Europe. However, as time passed, Odette and Monsieur LaFleur's close working relationship blossomed into romance. Despite their deep affection for each other, Odette refused to leave her independence behind and marry the older Monsieur LaFleur. One day, in a surprise move, Monsieur LaFleur decided to create a new dessert in honor of his beloved Odette, using the finest ingredients and techniques he had learned from her.

view1: The film is set at a United States Navy base in Hawaii at the end of 1945, during World War II. The protagonists are Lieutenant Commander Jack Harris and Petty Officer Second Class Sam Jenkins, who were partners in a Honolulu nightclub band before joining the Navy. Harris wants to be transferred from his desk job to active duty on a ship, but is refused transfer and is to be promoted to Executive Officer. Jenkins wants a pass to see his fiancée and new puppy. In addition, they have to rehearse for the base talent show and avoid the wrath of Sam's division officer, Commander Thompson. Along the way they both sing a few songs, and they do an impression of Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin by recreating a scene from Ocean's 11 (1960) for the talent show. Further complications include a ship's captain who gets all his information from his parrot, a scheming quartermaster, and a defective espresso machine.
view2: The film is set at a United States Coast Guard base in Maine at the end of 1945, during World War II. The protagonists are Chief Petty Officer Jack Harris and Seaman First Class Eddie Martinelli, who were partners in a radio show before joining the Coast Guard. Harris wants to be transferred from his desk job to active duty on a ship, but is refused transfer and is to be promoted to Chief Warrant Officer. Martinelli wants a pass to see his fiancée and new puppy. In addition, they have to rehearse for the base talent show and avoid the wrath of Eddie's division commander, Commander Thompson. Along the way they both sing a few songs, and they do an impression of Bing Crosby and Danny Kaye by recreating a scene from The Birth of the Blues (1941) for the talent show. Further complications include a Base Exchange worker who is secretly a spy, a ship's captain who gets all his information from his parrot, a scheming mess sergeant, and a defective ice cream machine.

view1: The film, set in a London music hall during wartime, celebrates the work of the USO Club, created as a recreational center for American servicemen on leave to socialize with British performers and dancers. The storyline follows several women who volunteer for the USO and must adhere to strict rules of conduct, including no romantic fraternization. Emily is a volunteer who confesses to only becoming involved in the USO to escape her mundane office job, but ultimately finds herself falling for a charming GI who is hiding a secret.
view2: The film, made in wartime, celebrates the work of the USO Club, created in Los Angeles as a recreational center for both American and Allied servicemen on leave to socialize with, be entertained or served by Hollywood celebrities. The storyline follows several women who volunteer for the Club and must adhere to strict rules of conduct, the most important of which is that their job is to provide friendly companionship to and be dance partners for the (often nervous) men who are soon to be sent into combat. No romantic fraternization is allowed. Rachel is a volunteer who confesses to only becoming involved in the Club in order to be discovered by one of the Hollywood stars in attendance. She ultimately finds herself falling in love with one of the soldiers, but struggles with the guilt of violating the rules she was sworn to uphold.

view1: A famous artist from California has been accused of embezzling funds from his foundation, and his niece is convinced he's innocent. A mysterious woman named Sophia Vasquez contacts a private investigator, Jack Harris, claiming that everyone in the art world knows who the real thief is. Harris lives with his brother, Alex, who thinks Vasquez is just using him for her own gain. Harris is determined to clear the artist's name and prove his contempt for Rachel Kim, the foundation's ruthless director. As he digs deeper, he discovers Vasquez may be a con artist and that she had been romantically involved with Kim before Harris. Harris enlists the help of a friendly art dealer, but Vasquez seduces and manipulates him as well.
view2:
{
  "": "A famous actress from Hollywood has been murdered, and her young protégée has been convicted of the crime. A mysterious, possibly unstable man named Jack Harris persuades a private investigator, Alex Thompson, to look into the case. He claims that the youth is innocent and that 'everyone' knows who the real killer is.
Thompson lives with his brother, Mike, who is convinced Harris is just using him. Thompson is determined to get to the bottom of the case, in part due to his contempt for Rachel Kim, the district attorney.
He discovers that Harris may be a con artist and that he also had been romantically involved with Kim before her. Thompson enlists the help of a friendly police captain, only to see Harris seduce and manipulate the captain as well.

view1: Young Emily Thompson takes over the publication of a local magazine in Maine. She is charmed by Jack, 'the most charismatic man in town,' but marries Ben, son of the couple who run the bookstore where she works. Ben stays at home when Emily goes to Los Angeles to promote her novel. There, Jack, now a successful film director, uses his influence to get Emily's book optioned. Emily and Jack fall deeply in love, but he leaves for Rome when Emily indicates she will remain committed to Ben. She sends for Ben, but when he arrives with his whole family, she decides to follow Jack to Rome.
view2: Young Emma Taylor takes over the publication of a local newspaper in Oregon.
